13 - Magnitude of these findings is comparable to other anti-poverty programs. Other programs are more expensive, but this KGFS model is much more sustainable.

12 - Farming and business investment +40% on average, and housing +22% on women borrowing. Also, across the income distribution there is an increase (the average increase is 13% increase). Effect is coming at the economy level, not just from getting loans and investing.

10 = straightforward regression. Controlling for the pair fixed effects. Then looks at main difference between treatment and control. Outcomes are FI index, poverty, women empowerment and mental health, and ag versus non ag occupation
